CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1941, pg. 6, reads: "Last Minute Rush for Courier Cooking School Tickets in on...Don't Wait...Get Yours Now! - The grand rush for tickets for The Courier Cooking School is on. Merchants are being swamped with requests.  Pictures above show some of the people purchasing the valuable ducats.  The school opens Thursday and continues through Saturday at the spacious Hill City Auditorium....A patron at Ballons Grocery, 1716 Wylie, joyfully receives her free tickets for the big Cooking School..."
TitMainTitle: Woman wearing dark suit receiving paper bag and ticket to Pittsburgh Courier's Cooking School from man wearing apron in Ballon's Grocery, 1716 Wylie Avenue
